intro: Leontodon reboudianus, commonly known as the Reboud's toothache plant, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact stature and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. Its leaves are linear and hairy, while its flowers consist of a central yellow disk surrounded by pale yellow ray florets. Leontodon reboudianus is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
